greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangular array: t(n,k) = number of partitions of n having lexicographic difference set of size k; see Comments.
comment: A partition P = [p(1), p(2), ..., p(k)] with p(1) >= p(2) >= ... >= p(k) has lexicographic difference set {0} union {|p(i) - p(i-1)|: 2 <= i <= k}. Column 2 is A049990, and the n-th row sum is A000041(n).
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
example: Row 5: the 7 partitions of 5 are shown here with difference sets:
Row 5 of the array is 1 3 3, these being the number of 0's, 1's, 2's in the "size" column.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 26 2016
